title: Chicago Blackhawks GM Resigns After Report on Team’s Handling of Sexual Misconduct Allegations Against a Coach
sub_head: Stan Bowman also said he would step down as general manager of the 2022 men’s Olympic ice hockey team
body:
The National Hockey League fined the Chicago Blackhawks $2 million and said two top officials left the team Tuesday in the wake of a damning report detailing the team’s handling of sexual misconduct allegations against a coach during its 2010 Stanley Cup season.
The league announced the fine and the departures of Blackhawks general manager Stan Bowman and senior vice president of hockey operations Al MacIsaac following the findings of an investigation conducted by Jenner & Block.
